content.description: Sit start with hands on a low flake.  Pull up and to a rail then throw over the lip for a deep jug.  Hand match in the jug and reach right for a sidepull.  Move you left up for another sidepull, then top out.
content.location: This is about 150 yards NW of the small parking area.  It's on a small face of the large boulder behind the boulder with V4.  Go around the right corner when facing the V4.

content.description:
Start laying back with hands matched on a rail on the south face of the boulder. Move right to round the corner onto the east face. Keep ascending and moving right till you top out just before rounding the corner to the north face.

The original line stays low on the wall with your feet following a rail underneath a small roof. If you stay low on the east face, you get to do a unique sequence involving a stem and a mantel. It is one of the coolest moves out at Riggs' on a low level problem.
content.protection: A pad if you want.  The traverse stays really low, so stepping off is not a problem.
content.location:
Go uphill about 70-80 feet from

V5-

.  If you're facing uphill, it is the left of two boulders forming a corridor up to the cliff band.  The problem starts just before entering the corridor and ascends up through it.
